A video of the attack has surfaced online, showing the man bleeding on a busy road. "They got married recently...Brothers of the deceased's wife assaulted Nagaraju," a policeman said.

175.title: Ukraine war has dragged on, doing everything to stop it: Belarus Prez
175.article_body: Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko has said that he didn't expect Ukraine war to "drag on this way", adding that he's doing everything he can to stop it. Lukashenko stated that using nuclear weapons in Ukraine is "unacceptable" because of the country's proximity to Belarus. Notably, his comments come amid Russia's recent simulated nuclear-capable missile strikes in its enclave of Kaliningrad.

176.title: Chief of B'luru-based ATREE elected to US' National Academy of Sciences
176.article_body: The chief of Bengaluru-based Ashoka Trust for Research in Ecology and the Environment (ATREE), Dr Kamal Bawa, has been elected to the US' National Academy of Sciences, according to a statement by ATREE. Dr Bawa said, "The election is...reaffirmation of our important work on the ecology, conservation and management of tropical forests that are declining...but are critical to humanity's well-being."

177.title: B'luru man kills 30-yr-old wife after celebrating his birthday, held
177.article_body: A 35-year-old man has been detained in Bengaluru on charges of allegedly killing his 30-year-old wife by strangling her to death. The accused allegedly killed his wife after she confronted him about his extra-marital affair. Doctors who checked the victim at the hospital suspected foul play after he told them she fell unconscious due to low blood pressure, reports said.

178.title: Andhra man accused of chain-snatching kills self in police custody
178.article_body: A suspect in a chain-snatching case, identified as Manipalli Appa Rao, allegedly died by suicide in police custody in Andhra Pradesh's Eluru. Police said that the man was arrested on May 1 and the incident took place when the accused went to take a bath. He was rushed to a hospital, but died during treatment, SP Rahul Dev Sharma said.

179.title: Johnny Depp forced Amber Heard to give him oral sex when he was angry: Psychologist
179.article_body: A clinical psychologist who testified at Johnny Depp's trial against Amber Heard said Depp forced Heard into oral sex when he was angry. "When Depp was drunk or high, he'd throw her on...bed, rip off her nightgown, and try to have sex with her," the psychologist, Dawn Hughes, testified. "These weren't in loving moments. These were angry moments," she said.

180.title: Hindu man allegedly killed by his Muslim wife's family in Hyd; act caught on camera
180.article_body: A 25-year-old Hindu man, B Nagaraju, was allegedly attacked with rods and beaten to death by the family of his Muslim wife Syed Ashrin Sulthana in Hyderabad, police said. A video of the attack has surfaced online, showing the man bleeding on a busy road. "They got married recently...Brothers of the deceased's wife assaulted Nagaraju," a police officer said.

181.title: Remove encroachment from Okhla within 2 weeks: HC to authorities
181.article_body: Delhi HC on Thursday directed authorities to take action for the removal of encroachment from Okhla Industrial Area within two weeks. It also directed Delhi Police to ensure sufficient force is provided to the concerned authorities. South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) and Delhi State Industrial and Infrastructure Development Corporation Limited will chalk out plan to remove the encroachment.

182.title: Delhi Police find no CCTV at MCD school where 2 girls were molested
182.article_body: Delhi Police didn't find any CCTVs installed inside the school where two girl students were allegedly molested by an unknown person inside their classroom in an MCD school. Based on the statements of the girls, a portrait of the accused has been sketched and two suspects have been zeroed in, police added.

183.title: India's biggest-ever IPO of LIC gets fully subscribed
183.article_body: LIC's IPO, India's biggest ever, was fully subscribed on the second day of bidding on Thursday.   The ₹20,557-crore IPO, with price band fixed at ₹902-949 per share, received bids for 16.24 crore equity shares against the offer size of 16.2 crore shares. The policyholder portion was subscribed 3.02 times, employee portion 2.14 times, and retail investors subscribed 91%.

184.title: Why is LIC  being sold at a throwaway price?: Rahul Gandhi on LIC IPO
184.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi accused the PM Narendra Modi-led government of "undervaluing" LIC, and questioned, "Why is one of India's most valuable assets being sold at a throwaway price?" India's largest-ever IPO of LIC, where the government is selling its 3.5% stake, expects to raise ₹20,557 crore. The LIC issue was fully subscribed on Thursday, the second day of bidding.

185.title: Delhi-Meerut RRTS train set ready, to be handed over on May 7
185.article_body: The first train set of the Delhi-Meerut Regional Rapid Transit System (RRTS) is ready and will be handed over to the National Capital Region Transport Corporation (NCRTC) on May 7. RRTS' train sets will be brought to Ghaziabad's Duhai depot. NCRTC said the train sets' manufacturing facility in Gujarat will deliver 210 cars for the first RRTS corridor.

186.title: CAA will be implemented the moment COVID-19 pandemic ends: Amit Shah
186.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah while addressing a public rally in West Bengal's Siliguri on Thursday said the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) will be implemented the moment COVID-19 pandemic ends. He said, "TMC is spreading rumours about CAA that it won't be implemented on the ground." Shah further said, "Mamata Didi wants infiltration...CAA was, is and will be a reality."

187.title: Big B & I used to discuss his films during 'Runway 34' shoot: Rakul
187.article_body: Rakul Preet Singh, talking about working with Amitabh Bachchan in 'Runway 34', has said, "I had a lot of discussions with him about his experience of the films that he has shot." She stated that both of them used to talk about his COVID-19 recovery, and his experience while shooting for 'Agneepath' and 'Coolie'. 'Runway 34' also featured Ajay Devgn.

188.title: Bihar at bottom of ladder in every index: Prashant Kishor
188.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor said that Bihar is at the bottom of the ladder in every index, adding that the state can't achieve the heights of development on the path it has taken so far. Over the next few months, Kishor said, he would interact with 18,000 people, both political and non-political, he met through his previous activities in Bihar.

189.title: BJP planning to demolish 2,000 unauthorised colonies in Delhi: AAP
189.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Thursday alleged that the BJP, which is ruling the three civic bodies, was planning to demolish 1,750 unauthorised and 860 slum colonies. In the last 17 years, BJP leaders in the civic bodies, councillors and mayors "amassed money" by allowing illegal construction to flourish only to serve them notices now, Sisodia alleged.

190.title: Mira Road police recover banned gutka products worth ₹15 lakh
190.article_body: A team of Mira Road police seized banned gutka products worth ₹15 lakh on Wednesday. This comes a week after the Mira Road police caught two men transporting gutka products in an auto-rickshaw. Police said they were looking for an absconding accused when they found the products. We are trying to ascertain the main source and supply chain, police added.

191.title: Mumbai man stabs woman & constable who came to help her, arrested
191.article_body: A 31-year-old man from Mumbai was arrested for allegedly stabbing a 25-year-old woman and an on-duty police constable who came to help her in Wadala. Police said that the accused and his family had contacted the woman's family with a marriage proposal, which they rejected and this angered the accused. The woman and the constable suffered deep wounds, police added.

192.title: Apologise to North Indians before entering Ayodhya: BJP MP to MNS chief
192.article_body: BJP MP Brijbhushan Sharan Singh has said he won't allow MNS chief Raj Thackeray to enter Ayodhya until he apologises to North Indians for his remarks made against them in 2008. "We have been watching since 2008, they brought to the fore the issue of 'Marathi Manush'," the MP added. Thackeray has announced his visit to Ayodhya on June 5.

193.title: Class 1 student crushed to death by bus on school premises in UP
193.article_body: A six-year-old Class 1 student died after a school bus rammed into him on the premises of Royal Convent Inter College in UP's Baghpat on Thursday, police said. The incident occurred when the bus driver was reversing the vehicle. The victim's body has been sent for post-mortem and an FIR has been registered against the school manager and the driver.

194.title: Over 600 Ukrainian fighters killed in artillery strikes: Russia
194.article_body: Russia's Defence Ministry said on Thursday that over 600 Ukrainian fighters were killed after its artillery struck multiple Ukrainian positions and strongholds overnight. It added that 61 units of weapons and military equipment were also destroyed in the artillery strikes. Meanwhile, Ukraine has accused that Russia is "resorting to the missile terrorism tactics to spread fear across Ukraine".

195.title: DGCA starts night checks of airplanes following SpiceJet flight turbulence
195.article_body: DGCA has initiated surprise night checks to assess the fitness of aircrafts across several airports following recent turbulence on SpiceJet's Mumbai-Durgapur flight. DGCA has directed teams to examine cockpits, cabins and check for potential safety hazards like loose fittings of aircraft seats and windows. "If airlines are found [violating] rules, they're liable to pay heavy penalties," it said.

196.title: Kanye was upset because I called him rapper during SNL monologue: Kim
196.article_body: Kim Kardashian, during an episode of 'The Kardashians', has revealed the reason why her ex-husband Kanye West was "upset" by her Saturday Night Live (SNL) monologue. "Kanye wished I said the word 'filed' for divorce...he was upset that I also said he was a rapper. He said, 'I'm...much more than a rapper...can't believe you said rapper," Kim told Khloé Kardashian.

197.title: Meta wristband to control smart glasses, other devices: Zuckerberg
197.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Wednesday shared a picture of eyewear maker EssilorLuxottica's chairman using a prototype of Meta's neural interface wristband. He wrote, "[The wristband] will eventually let you control your [smart] glasses and other devices." Last year, Meta had said it planned to develop a wristband that'd allow users to interact with a virtual world using finger movements.

198.title: Why would someone play 5-day cricket and get ₹5 lakh: Yuvraj on 'dying' Test cricket
198.article_body: Former India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh has opined that Test cricket is dying, adding that people want to play and watch T20 cricket. "Why would someone play five-day cricket and get ₹5 lakh [when cricketers] today play T20 cricket and get ₹50 lakh?" He added, "Players who have not made it to international cricket are getting ₹7-10 crore."

199.title: Journalist Pawan Jaiswal, who exposed roti-salt mid-day meal in UP school, dies of cancer
199.article_body: Journalist Pawan Jaiswal, who had filmed students at a government school in Uttar Pradesh eating rotis with salt as their mid-day meal in 2019, passed away after battling oral cancer. The journalist was struggling to pay for his treatment and had appealed for funds last month. "Deeply saddened to hear about the untimely demise of this honest...journalist," tweeted Urmila Matondkar.

200.title: Govt plans to cut taxes on edible oils to curb rising prices: Report
200.article_body: The government is planning to cut taxes on some edible oils to curb the rising prices, Bloomberg reported on Thursday. Prices of edible oil have soared in the country after the war in Ukraine and Indonesia's ban on palm oil exports. India is reportedly looking to slash the agriculture infrastructure and development cess on crude palm oil imports from 5%.

201.title: Amit Shah should form panel to probe riots if he has courage: Gehlot
201.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said Home Minister Amit Shah should form a committee to probe the cause of riots in seven states "if he has the courage". Everything will become clear and riots won't happen, Gehlot added. Referring to repeated violence in Rajasthan, Gehlot said, "It's [BJP's] attempt to ignite a fire as they're losing the next [Rajasthan Assembly] election."

202.title: Cong delegation to visit UP's Lalitpur to meet rape victim's family
202.article_body: A six-member delegation of Congress will visit UP's Lalitpur to meet the family of the alleged rape victim. Earlier on Wednesday, Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav met the victim's family. The 13-year-old rape survivor was allegedly raped again by the Station House Officer when she went to the police station to file a complaint against four men for gangraping her.

203.title: Chhattisgarh CM announces helicopter ride for Classes 10, 12 board toppers
203.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Thursday said the students who will top in Classes 10 and 12 board examinations will be rewarded with a helicopter ride. The rides will be offered to district-wise toppers, he added. "I believe...a helicopter ride will inculcate in the minds of children a desire to fly high in the skies of life," Baghel said.

204.title: Thane man gets 2 yrs in jail for flashing private parts at school girl
204.article_body: A special court has sentenced a 32-year-old man to two years in jail for flashing his private parts at a school girl in Thane in 2018. The accused would wait at spot en route to school and flash victim as she'd pass by. The victim later complained to her mother about act, following which accused was handed over to police.

205.title: Man dies as accused puts him in car's boot & drives for hours in B'luru
205.article_body: A 33-year-old man died from breathlessness and suffocation after an accused put him in the boot of a car and drove around Bengaluru for hours, according to reports. Later, the accused and his partners dumped his body on a pavement and fled. The accused was reportedly in a relationship with the victim's wife. Police have arrested him and his partners.

206.title: Odisha sounds cyclone alert, 18 districts asked to take measures
206.article_body: The Odisha government has issued an alert of a possible cyclone over the Bay of Bengal. Odisha Special Relief Commissioner (SRC) has also written to the collectors of 18 districts, asking them to undertake all measures to safeguard people and their properties. "The state is well prepared for the eventuality if any," Odisha chief secretary SC Mohapatra had earlier said.

207.title: Bank of England warns of recession in the UK, hikes interest rates to 1%
207.article_body: The Bank of England on Thursday raised the interest rates by 25 bps to 1%, the highest since 2009.  The move is aimed at countering the inflation that's now heading above 10%. The Bank of England also sent a warning that the UK economy risks sliding into recession later this year amid higher energy prices pushing inflation.

208.title: Vegetable vendor's daughter clears civil judge exam in MP's Indore
208.article_body: A 29-year-old daughter of a vegetable vendor in Madhya Pradesh's Indore has cleared the civil judge exam. Ankita Nagar, who cleared the exam in her fourth attempt, said she used to help her father after completing her preparations. "Despite three unsuccessful attempts, I did not give up...This struggle opened doors for me and I kept moving forward," Nagar said.

209.title: May you always live life with joy & courage: Katrina on mom's 70th b'day
209.article_body: Katrina Kaif wished her mother, Suzanne Turquotte, on her birthday. Taking to Instagram, Katrina gave a glimpse of her mother's 70th birthday which she celebrated with her family. The pictures had Suzanne posing with her birthday cake. Alongside the post, Katrina wrote, "Happy 70th mama. May you always live life with...joy and courage that you do...surrounded by your...noisy kids."

210.title: Western intelligence to Ukraine won't thwart our goals: Russia
210.article_body: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said Russia is "aware" that the US, Britain and other NATO nations are "constantly" feeding intelligence to Ukraine. This wouldn't stop Russia from achieving its military objectives in Ukraine, he added. Peskov's comments came in response to a New York Times report stating that US had provided intelligence that helped Ukrainian forces kill many Russian generals.

211.title: Concept of regional movies exists in India only: Hansika Motwani
211.article_body: Actress Hansika Motwani has said the concept of regional movies exists in India only, whereas the world views such films as "Indian movies". "After the remarkable feat of certain movies from the South, the scenario has completely changed," she added. "Today, it's nice to see that people have started accepting the movies in every region with red carpets," Hansika stated.

212.title: It took cajoling to attend Ranbir-Alia's party post accident: Malaika
212.article_body: Malaika Arora has said that she was afraid of sitting in the car for the next 15 days after her car accident which took place in April. "There is fear, worry and anxiety. It takes cajoling to get me out, anywhere," she stated. "In fact, it took some cajoling to attend Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's wedding bash," she added.

213.title: Meta freezes hiring for 2022 after slow revenue growth: Report
213.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta has temporarily stopped hiring for the remainder of 2022 and is lowering hiring targets, Reuters reported citing Business Insider. This comes after Meta last week recorded its slowest revenue growth in a decade. "In light of the expense guidance given for this earnings period, we are slowing [talent] growth accordingly," a Meta spokesperson said in an e-mailed statement.

214.title: Delhi to give electricity subsidy to only those who ask for it from Oct 1: CM
214.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday announced that from October 1, subsidy on electricity will be provided to only those who ask for it. "Now cheap electricity will be optional in Delhi," Kejriwal said. He added that if someone considers himself capable, then he can tell the Delhi government that he doesn't want the subsidy.

215.title: Delimitation panel finalises electoral seats in J&K; increases Assembly seats to 90
215.article_body: The Delimitation Commission tasked with redrawing the assembly constituencies of Jammu and Kashmir finalised the delimitation order for the Union Territory. As per the final Delimitation Order, the Assembly constituencies have been increased to 90, of which 43 will be part of Jammu region and 47 of Kashmir region. Nine seats have been reserved for STs and seven for SCs.

216.title: Armenia detains dozens of protesters demanding PM's resignation
216.article_body: Police in Armenia on Thursday detained dozens of protesters demanding Armenian PM Nikol Pashinyan's resignation. Local television footage showed police officers grabbing and dragging protesters into vans. Pashinyan has faced backlash since he agreed to a Russian-brokered truce to end six weeks of war with Azerbaijan over the disputed region of Nagorno-Karabakh in November 2020.

217.title: I'll think twice about doing a remake if original's available on OTT: Kiara
217.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani said she will "think twice" about acting in a remake if the original film is available on an OTT platform. "I did 'Kabir Singh' before OTT became a rage," added Kiara. 'Kabir Singh' which also starred Shahid Kapoor, was a remake of the 2017 Telugu film 'Arjun Reddy'. Kiara will be next seen in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'.

218.title: Stepping down was a mistake, Dhoni should've led from start: Sehwag
218.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has said naming Ravindra Jadeja as CSK captain in place of MS Dhoni was a mistake. "Also, I think, if Jadeja was the captain, he should've been sustained for the rest of the season," Sehwag added. "Had Dhoni been the captain from the beginning then...maybe CSK wouldn't have lost so many matches," he further said.

219.title: 3 robots handed over to Pune civic body to help clean manholes
219.article_body: Three robots will be used to clean manholes in Pune. "These robots have been handed over to the civic solid waste management department...There have been incidents...when sanitation workers working in manholes have died...The use of robots for cleaning manholes would get the PMC's choked and blocked sewage lines cleaned without putting human life at risk," an official said.

220.title: Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani gets 3 months in jail over 2017 'Azadi' march
220.article_body: A Gujarat court on Thursday sentenced Vadgam MLA Jignesh Mevani and nine others, including NCP's Reshma Patel, to three months in jail in a 2017 case of holding 'Azadi' march without permission. The court found them guilty of being part of unlawful assembly under IPC section 143. The march was taken out from Mahesana to Dhanera in the Banaskantha district.

221.title: Elon Musk secures over $7 billion in new financing to buy Twitter
221.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk has secured $7.139 billion in new financing commitments for the acquisition of Twitter, a company filing showed on Thursday. The investors who committed financing include the world's largest crypto exchange Binance, Oracle Co-founder Larry Ellison, Vy Capital and Sequoia Capital Fund among others. Last month, Musk struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion.

222.title: Shaw's batting like he doesn't care, Pant should speak to him: Ajay Jadeja
222.article_body: Sharing his opinion on DC opener Prithvi Shaw, ex-India batter Ajay Jadeja said, "Shaw is batting as if he doesn't care." "If this is how he wants to bat, I would advice Rishabh Pant to...tell Shaw- 'If you are...going to throw the bat at every ball, I can also do that. So let me only open the innings'," added Jadeja.

223.title: BJP playing bulldozer politics, entire Delhi will collapse: Manish Sisodia
223.article_body: Amid anti-encroachment drive in Delhi, Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia accused BJP of playing bulldozer politics and said notices should be sent to councillors who allowed illegal construction. "Notices have been sent to 1,750 unauthorised...colonies where...50 lakh people live...[and] 860 colonies...where 10 lakh people live...," he said. "In this way, entire Delhi will collapse," he added.

224.title: US hospital sued over racism as black woman dies after C-section
224.article_body: A US hospital has been sued by a man whose wife, a black woman, died after childbirth in 2016. The man has claimed that his wife bled to death because of a culture of racism at the hospital. "There's no doubt in my mind that my wife would be here today...if she was a Caucasian woman," he said.

225.title: Big B shares teaser of Kangana's song from Dhaakad; deletes it later
225.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan shared the teaser of actress Kangana Ranaut's song from 'Dhaakad', however, he soon deleted it. Amitabh shared the post on Instagram and wrote, "All good wishes." He also tagged Kangana, Arjun Rampal, Divya Dutta and other members of the team. He later deleted the post. Kangana had also shared the same teaser on her social media on Wednesday.

226.title: In UP if girls go to get justice, victims are made the accused: Mamata
226.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee criticised the Uttar Pradesh government and said, "Today in UP if girls go to get justice, victims are made the accused." "I don't even leave my own (party workers) if they're guilty. But there are some who keep circulating fake videos," she added. "Bengal is better than other states," the TMC chief said.

227.title: Gujarat MLA Mevani sentenced to 3-month jail for 'Azadi' march in 2017
227.article_body: A Gujarat court has sentenced MLA Jignesh Mevani and nine others to three months in jail for taking out an 'Azadi' march on the first anniversary of the Una flogging incident without permission in 2017. NCP functionary Reshma Patel is among those convicted. Notably, Mevani was recently arrested by Assam Police over his alleged objectionable tweets about PM Narendra Modi.

228.title: When I heard Jadeja would lead CSK, I was blown away: Shane Watson
228.article_body: Talking about Ravindra Jadeja handing back CSK captaincy to MS Dhoni, former all-rounder Shane Watson said, "When I had initially heard that Ravindra Jadeja was going to take over, I was blown away!" He added, "It was always going to be difficult for Jadeja no matter what. In the end, I do feel a little bit sorry for Jadeja."

229.title: Taapsee is a rare actress who's also a good human being: Sudhir Mishra
229.article_body: Speaking about working with actress Taapsee Pannu in his film, director Sudhir Mishra said, "I'm...glad I worked with her. She's a rare actress who's also a good human being, so working with her was a breeze." "I needed a...good actress who could be seen ageing over 30 years in half an hour. Taapsee...managed the transition very smoothly," he added.

230.title: Didn't make any money from Shark Tank: Ashneer on reports of getting ₹10 lakh per episode
230.article_body: Ashneer Grover, speaking about Shark Tank India, said, "None of us made any money from the show." "Some people said...we made ₹10 lakh per episode, but I'd have been happy with even ₹5 lakh...They asked us to commit to spending ₹10 crore each...We said okay," he added. "We weren't paid anything; in fact, we worked like bonded labour," Ashneer stated.

231.title: Filled with joy: Sood on meeting girl whom he helped overcome spinal defect
231.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood recently met Janhvi, a girl whom he helped a few months ago for her surgery as she suffered from a spinal disorder since birth. Janhvi and her father went to Shirdi to meet Sood. While speaking about the same, Sood said, "It fills my heart with joy to watch the young girl stand on her own and...walk."

232.title: MI should have stuck with Tim David a lot more: Shane Watson
232.article_body: DC assistant coach Shane Watson has said he was surprised that MI played Tim David only for two games before dropping him at the start of the IPL season. "They should've stuck with a lot more, even for 4-5 games to see what he can do," added Watson. David played his third game against RR and scored a match-winning 20*(9).

233.title: RPF Bengaluru seizes illicit liquor worth over ₹20,000
233.article_body: The Railway Protection Force (RPF) of the Bengaluru division on Wednesday apprehended a person and seized illicit liquor worth approximately ₹20,235. A total of 576 tetra packs of 90 ml whiskey were found in the passenger's bags, the South Western Railway said. The liquor has been handed over to excise department officials, it added, sharing the photo of the seizure.

234.title: Pope uses wheelchair for first time in public due to knee pain
234.article_body: Pope Francis was seen using a wheelchair for the first time in public when he attended the plenary assembly of the International Union of Superiors General at the Vatican on Thursday. He is said to be suffering from knee pain, which has restricted his movement. He has lately been struggling to walk or stand.

235.title: Roads near Sri Lankan parliament blocked for public amid protests
235.article_body: Police have blocked roads near Sri Lankan parliament to the public for the days the House will be in session amid the country's ongoing economic crisis. This comes after 12 anti-government protesters were arrested near the premises for demanding the resignation of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa. People residing near parliament will have to show identity proof to commute through these roads.

236.title: BJP discussing Rahul's nightclub visit, not pressing issues: Shiv Sena
236.article_body: Shiv Sena criticised the BJP for ignoring pressing issues but targeting Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for his nightclub visit. "Instead of discussing power shortage, lack of jobs, the question of the support price for farmers, inflation, the Chinese army infiltrating the country's borders, members of BJP are still shooting arrows at Rahul Gandhi's visit to Nepal," the Shiv Sena said.

237.title: Unicorn DealShare looks to hire 1,500 people by the end of FY23
237.article_body: Grocery-focused social commerce startup DealShare, valued at $1.7 billion in January, is looking to hire up to 1,500 employees across tech and product side by the end of FY23. As per CEO Vineet Rao, DealShare has already doubled its workforce to 2,000 since last year. It's also planning to acquire 5-10 small brands with their own manufacturing units, Rao said.

238.title: SDMC's anti-encroachment drive near Shaheen Bagh cancelled till Friday
238.article_body: The anti-encroachment drives in the Kalindi Kunj-Jamia Nagar area near Shaheen Bagh and in Sriniwaspuri have been cancelled till Friday, South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) said on Thursday. "The police informed us...adequate force cannot be provided for the drive today. We will reschedule the drive accordingly," SDMC added. Earlier, a drive in Jasola and Sarita Vihar was also cancelled.

239.title: Prayagraj to get Uttar Pradesh's first floating restaurant
239.article_body: The Yogi Adityanath-led government in Uttar Pradesh is planning to build a floating restaurant in Prayagraj, which will be the first such restaurant in the state. The proposed floating restaurant, which is coming up at the Boat Club, will run on the PPP model and will offer a whole range of cuisines, a government spokesperson said.

240.title: 23-yr-old medical intern sets herself on fire at Noida park, note found
240.article_body: A 23-year-old medical intern from Delhi's Greater Kailash area set herself ablaze at a park in Noida on Wednesday, with police suspecting that she took the step due to a mental health condition. Police found a hand-written note, a two-litre empty bottle of diesel, a purse and a mobile phone on the spot. Police and forensic experts reached the area.

241.title: Hit those who don’t say Bharat Mata ki Jai with sticks: BJP’s Gyan Dev
241.article_body: BJP leader Gyan Dev Ahuja appealed to people to "hit" those who don’t say "Bharat Mata ki Jai" with sticks. "Muslims never ruled India. It was ruled by Mughals and Afghans. Hit those who don’t say Bharat Mata ki Jai with sticks," Ahuja said while speaking at BJP’s Jan Hunkar Rally in Alwar.

242.title: Hindus suffered more due to MNS' stand on loudspeakers: Cong leader
242.article_body: Maharashtra Congress spokesperson Sachin Sawant on Thursday claimed Hindus have suffered more because of MNS chief Raj Thackeray's objection over the use of loudspeakers at mosques. "If we listen to...MNS, along with masjids, 2,400 temples will also not be able to use loudspeakers," he tweeted. MNS' agitation will have repercussions across all religious communities, Sawant added.

243.title: 3 men strip minor boys for gambling, beat them & film act in Hyd
243.article_body: Three men, who allegedly assaulted a group of minor boys after making them strip in Hyderabad's Old City, were arrested after a video of the incident surfaced online. According to the police, the men found the group of boys gambling. To teach them a lesson, the accused hit them with a stick and recorded the act, police added.

244.title: We have ignored Northeast India, it is very disheartening: Ayushmann
244.article_body: Talking about his upcoming film 'Anek' which is based in Northeast India, Ayushmann Khurrana said, "We have...ignored Northeast India...and the kind of racism they face in the mainland...it's very disheartening." "People from the mainland will realise where they are going wrong," added Ayushmann. "It's a very...different film which Indian cinema hasn't witnessed in the past," stated Ayushmann.

245.title: Pant takes all the pressure, responsibility on himself: Chetan Sakariya
245.article_body: Speaking about his tenure with DC, pacer Chetan Sakariya praised coach Ricky Ponting and skipper Rishabh Pant for keeping him motivated. He added, "Pant takes all the pressure, responsibility on himself...[and] whenever the other players do well, he gives them credit." Sakariya has picked one wicket in the two games he has played so far in IPL 2022.

246.title: Russia stole 4,00,000 tonnes of grain: Ukraine
246.article_body: Russia has stolen 4,00,000 tonnes of grain from occupied regions in southern Ukraine, Ukrainian Defence Ministry said. "Russian thieves are bringing death and famine to the world," it added. As per International Grains Council data, Ukraine sold 44.7 million tonnes of grain abroad in 2020-21, making it the world's fourth-largest supplier. The volume of exports has fallen sharply amid war.

247.title: Delhivery shares fall in unlisted market ahead of its IPO: Report
247.article_body: Logistics startup Delhivery's shares fell nearly 40% in the unlisted market from the peak of ₹950/share in January ahead of its upcoming IPO, Moneycontrol reported. The unlisted shares are reportedly quoting at ₹550-600/share on thin trading volume. Delhivery's price band, at ₹462-487/share, is about 19% lower than the current unlisted share price. It aims to raise ₹5,235 crore.

248.title: Boy who ranked 45th in K'taka Police exam paid agent ₹50 lakh: CID
248.article_body: The Karnataka CID team revealed that father of a BSc graduate who secured 45th rank in police sub-inspector recruitment exam had paid ₹50 lakh to an agent to secure higher rank. "The family members of many candidates were actively involved in financing the cheating," a police official said. The recruitment process has now been declared cancelled by the Karnataka government.

249.title: RBI hike to increase SBI's lending rate by 0.02%: SBI Chairman
249.article_body: SBI Chairman Dinesh Kumar Khara has said that the 40 bps hike in repo rate to 4.40% will increase SBI's marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) by two basis points. He further said that the removal of excess liquidity from the market will "improve the pricing of loans". As per RBI's announcement, liquidity worth ₹87,000 crore could be withdrawn.

250.title: Apple stops accepting debit & credit cards for app purchases, subscriptions in India
250.article_body: Apple has stopped accepting debit and credit cards to buy apps from the App Store, use Apple subscriptions like iCloud+ and Apple Music in India. Apple's support page states that the company currently only supports net-banking, UPI and Apple ID balance as payment options. This comes after new auto-debit rules from RBI came into force last year.

251.title: I wish to see a Brahmin as the CM of Maharashtra: Union Minister
251.article_body: Union Minister Raosaheb Patil Danve has said, "I just don't want to see Brahmins as corporators or civic body heads, I wish to see a Brahmin as the CM of [Maharashtra]." He added that so much casteism has come into politics that it cannot be ignored. "There should be a leader who can keep communities together," Patil said.

252.title: 4 terror suspects with Pak link caught with huge cache of explosives in Haryana
252.article_body: Four terror suspects were caught with a huge cache of explosives in Haryana's Karnal city on Thursday. Karnal SP Ganga Ram Punia informed that the accused were in touch with a Pakistan-based man who asked them to drop arms and ammunition in Adilabad, Telangana. The four accused were identified as Gurpreet, Amandeep, Parminder, and Bhupinder, hailing from Ferozepur and Ludhiana.

253.title: Many eco-friendly children’s clothing contain toxic PFAS: Study
253.article_body: Many children's products like clothes, bedding and furniture, including those with green certifications, contain harmful PFAS chemicals, also known as forever chemicals, a study has found. The products labelled as water or stain-resistant are most likely to contain PFAS that aren't listed on label. PFAS are linked with health conditions like cancer, thyroid disease, high cholesterol, asthma, etc.

254.title: Hyd woman's brother arrested for killing her husband over inter-faith marriage
254.article_body: After a 25-year-old man was killed by his wife's family over their inter-faith marriage in Hyderabad, police have arrested her brother in connection with the incident. The couple was returning home on a motorcycle when they were waylaid and attacked with a crowbar. The man died on the spot while the woman was injured.

255.title: WhatsApp starts rolling out emoji reactions for messages
255.article_body: Meta-owned WhatsApp has started rolling out emoji reactions for messages, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced. Zuckerberg said WhatsApp is also adding the folded hands emoji "to help spread thanks and appreciation". "Emoji reactions are coming to WhatsApp so people can quickly share their opinion without flooding chats with new messages," WhatsApp had said in April.

256.title: Which batters have faced the most balls in IPL history?
256.article_body: RCB's Virat Kohli on Wednesday became the first batter to face at least 5,000 deliveries in IPL history. Kohli has faced 5,028 balls in IPL. He is followed by PBKS opener Shikhar Dhawan, who has faced 4,863 deliveries in IPL. MI captain Rohit Sharma has faced 4,429 deliveries, while DC opener David Warner has faced 4,062 deliveries.

257.title: I went into a dark place last summer and feared I'd never play cricket again: Archer
257.article_body: Talking about recovering from his injury, England pacer Jofra Archer, who last played a professional match in July 2021, said that he went into a dark place last summer and feared he'd never play cricket again. Archer, who is expecting to make a comeback this month, added, "Suppose...I had rushed my comeback...I might have messed things up more."

258.title: Woman secretly pokes holes in man's condoms in Germany, found guilty of sexual assault
258.article_body: A German court found a woman guilty of sexual assault and handed her a six-month suspended sentence for purposefully damaging her partner's condoms by poking holes in them, German media reported. "We've written legal history," the judge reportedly told the court. "The condoms were rendered unusable without the man's knowledge or...consent. No means no here as well," the judge said.

259.title: Was stuck in make-up van for 3 days with network issues: Anees on Mumbai floods
259.article_body: Filmmaker Anees Bazmee said that he was stuck in his make-up van during 2005 Mumbai floods. "I got stuck in bumper-to-bumper traffic. I took U-Turn and came back to shooting spot, and took refuge in make-up van. There were network issues too...I was stuck in the van for three days. We faced difficulty in getting food and water," he added.

260.title: Rohit is disappointed for not being able to convert his starts: Jayawardena
260.article_body: Talking about captain Rohit Sharma's form in IPL 2022, MI head coach Mahela Jayawardena said, "He is disappointed that he has not been able to convert his starts but it’s about executing our game plans." So far, Rohit has scored 155 runs in nine games at an average of 17.22. He's yet to cross the 50-run mark in the tournament.

261.title: Delhi man grows plants on roof of his auto to beat heat, pics surface
261.article_body: Amid the ongoing heatwave conditions across the country, an auto-rickshaw driver in Delhi planted a variety of plants on the roof of his auto-rickshaw to beat the heat. The driver, Mahendra Kumar, said that there are 25 varieties of plants that are planted on the auto-rickshaw's roof. Kumar added, "Auto-rickshaw used to simmer during summers, but now it remains cool."

262.title: Pune ZP to procure essential items needed in 109 primary health centres
262.article_body: Pune Zilla Parishad (ZP) will procure essential items needed in its 109 primary health centres by May-end, an official confirmed. A gap in items worth ₹21 crore was identified of which ₹17 crore was raised through corporate social responsibility and remaining funds will be given by administration. There'll be improvement in services provided at these centres, Pune ZP CEO said.

263.title: 'I just can't bat with you, you run too fast', Maxwell jokingly tells Kohli after run-out
263.article_body: After being run-out for 3(3) while batting with Virat Kohli against CSK, RCB all-rounder Glenn Maxwell jokingly told Kohli, "I just can't bat with you." He added, "You run too fast. You hit ones and twos. I don't." Maxwell was run-out after Kohli called for a quick single on the last delivery of the ninth over.

264.title: Rainfall predicted in several states/UTs; IMD releases list
264.article_body: IMD has predicted moderate to light rainfall in Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, Tripura, Bihar, Jharkhand, West Bengal, Sikkim, Odisha, Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh and Telangana during next five days. Light rainfall is likely over J&K, Ladakh, Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand during next three days and in Punjab, Haryana and UP today.

265.title: Sketch of man who took off 2 girls' clothes at Delhi school released
265.article_body: A sketch of the man who allegedly entered a municipal school in Delhi and sexually assaulted two girls has been released by the police. According to Delhi Commission for Women chief Swati Maliwal, the man took off the girls' clothes and urinated in front of an entire class. Police said that continuous efforts are on to arrest the accused.

266.title: Committee should be formed to probe riot incidents: Gehlot
266.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that if Union Home Minister Amit Shah has "courage" then a committee should be formed to probe recent riots across various states. "People showered flowers on Ram Navami processions. Riots happened in seven states and bulldozers were used," Gehlot added. "A similar method like that of Karauli was used in all seven states," Gehlot stated.

267.title: QR code-enabled billboards to be put up in B'luru for anti-tobacco campaign
267.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar has launched a campaign, '#IndiaVsTobacco', to work towards a tobacco-free country. He also unveiled QR code-enabled billboards and posters, which will be put up across Bengaluru for interactive engagement regarding tobacco related health impacts. The billboards reportedly contain a fact about secondhand smoke that people can view by scanning the QR codes.

268.title: 211 arrested after clashes in Jodhpur on Eid: Rajasthan DGP
268.article_body: As many as 211 people have been arrested in connection with clashes that broke out in Jodhpur on Eid, Rajasthan DGP ML Lather said. A curfew, which was imposed in several areas of Jodhpur following the clashes, continued for the third day on Thursday. Four FIRs have been registered by the police and 15 have been registered based on complaints.

269.title: 45 teachers involved in Andhra SSC paper leak: Education Minister
269.article_body: Andhra Pradesh Education Minister Botcha Satyanarayana on Thursday said that 45 teachers were involved in the alleged leak of question papers from the ongoing SSC exams for Class 10 students.  The government has taken action against 69 people, he added. The teachers have been accused of taking photos of the question papers after exams commenced and leaking them online.

270.title: I am not happy with my performance, haven't lived up to expectations: Siraj
270.article_body: RCB pacer Mohammed Siraj said he is "not happy" with his performance in IPL 2022 so far, adding that he has not lived up to the expectations of the fans. "Believe in me, I will make a comeback," stated Siraj. Siraj has picked eight wickets in IPL 2022 so far at an economy rate of 9.47.

271.title: 22 killed, 40 injured as heavy rains trigger floods in Afghanistan
271.article_body: At least 22 people have been killed and around 40 others have been injured after heavy rains in Afghanistan triggered floods, a disaster management official said on Thursday. Hundreds of houses and some 3,000 acres of crops have also been damaged due to the rains. As per the officials, the Taliban government will approach international relief organisations for help.

272.title: I'm excited: Shivangi Joshi on being a part of Khatron Ke Khiladi 12
272.article_body: Actress Shivangi Joshi said that she will be a part of the show 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12'. She added, "'Khatron Ke Khiladi' is going to be my first ever reality show and I am extremely excited...The show will be a good platform to overcome my fears and test my abilities." "I'm looking forward to meeting Rohit Shetty sir," she said.

273.title: US Prez Biden declares disaster in wildfire-hit New Mexico
273.article_body: US President Joe Biden has approved a disaster declaration for several parts of New Mexico that have been hit by massive wildfires. According to experts, the wildfires are more widespread than usual owing to climate change. Several counties of the state, including Mora, San Miguel, Colfax and Valencia, will receive federal funding for rehabilitation after hundreds of houses were burnt.

274.title: 7 people booked for uploading child pornography in Pimpri Chinchwad
274.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Police on Wednesday registered two separate cases against seven individuals who uploaded child pornography content. According to police, the content had been posted last year on various social media websites. Additionally, police have initiated a probe into the cell phone numbers, email addresses and social media accounts used by the accused to upload the content.

275.title: Have assurance, US won't allow Russia to act against us: Sweden
275.article_body: Sweden has said if Russia directs any activities against it, the US will not allow it. The statement comes after Swedish Foreign Minister Ann Linde met US Secretary of State Antony Blinken. Linde said Sweden will receive support while its potential application for NATO membership is processed. "I feel very sure that now we have an American assurance," she said.

276.title: DMK MPs to contribute one month's salary towards Sri Lanka aid
276.article_body: The Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) on Thursday announced that the party's Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha MP's will be donating their one month's salary towards aid for the crisis-hit Sri Lanka. This comes after Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin appealed to the people to donate to the state government to buy essentials like food and ship them to Sri Lanka.

277.title: Pic shows tunnel used by Pak terrorists in J&K; BSF says Amarnath Yatra attack plan foiled
277.article_body: The BSF on Thursday said that it has detected a freshly dug cross-border tunnel that originated from Pakistan along the International Border in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba district. "With the detection of this tunnel, BSF-Jammu has foiled the nefarious designs of Pakistan-based terrorists to disrupt the upcoming Amarnath Yatra," BSF DIG said.

278.title: A run-a-ball 40 doesn't suit Pant, won't take DC anywhere: Sehwag
278.article_body: Sharing his opinion on DC captain Rishabh Pant, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said, "He must not carry any baggage and play like the [old Pant]. A run-a-ball 40 doesn't suit Pant and [won't]...take DC anywhere." "When Pant plays with responsibility, the strike rate falls," added Sehwag. Pant has scored 234 runs in nine IPL 2022 matches so far.

279.title: Nobody should speak language of ultimatum: Ajit Pawar to Raj Thackeray
279.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar criticised Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray's "ultimatum to Maharashtra government" remark and said that nobody should speak the "language of ultimatum". "This is not a dictatorship. If you want to give an ultimatum sitting inside your home to your family members, do it, we have nothing to do with it," he added.

280.title: HC grants bail to Pune man booked for raping 17-yr-old niece in 2019
280.article_body: A man from Pune who was booked for raping his minor niece in 2019 has been given bail by the Bombay High Court. The court said the 17-year-old girl was a college-going girl with sufficient understanding. As per a complaint, the man met the girl in college and forcibly took her to a hotel where he sexually assaulted her.

281.title: Didn't feel like a normal scene: Amber on kissing Depp during Rum Diary shoot
281.article_body: Amber Heard recalled her kiss with Johnny Depp while shooting for 'Rum Diary' while testifying during the defamation trial. Amber said the shower scene "didn't feel like a normal scene. It felt real." Recalling an incident in Depp's trailer, she said, "He...picked up...back of my robe with his boot...I...turned around and giggled...He...playfully pushed me down on...bed, sofa...he said, 'Yum'."

282.title: Facebook became Frankenstein monster, devoured user data: WhatsApp's ex-CBO
282.article_body: WhatsApp's former Chief Business Officer (CBO) Neeraj Arora, who regrets WhatsApp's $22 billion sale to Facebook in 2014, tweeted, "Nobody knew in the beginning that Facebook would become a Frankenstein monster that devoured user data and spat out dirty money." He added, "We didn’t either." Arora also said, "Tech companies need to admit when they have done wrong."

283.title: Police stations have become 'centre of chaos' under BJP rule: Akhilesh
283.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav criticised the BJP-led UP government and held it responsible for the Lalitpur rape case incident and said that police stations have become the "centre of chaos". "The walls of Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath's house are unable to hear the problems of people," he added. Lalitpur SHO is accused of sexually assaulting a 13-year-old rape survivor.

284.title: 2 men die as bulldozer tyre bursts while filling air in Chhattisgarh, video surfaces
284.article_body: Two people were killed when a bulldozer tyre exploded while they were filling air in it at a vehicle workshop in Chhattisgarh. Footage shows a worker filling air in the tyre. Another man then comes and presses the tyre in order to check the air pressure, which leads to the explosion. The incident took place in Raipur's Siltara industrial area.

285.title: WhatsApp's ex-CBO shares Co-founder's old handwritten 'No Ads! No Games!' note
285.article_body: WhatsApp's former CBO Neeraj Arora, who said that he regrets WhatsApp's $22 billion sale to Facebook in 2014, shared a handwritten note by WhatsApp Co-founder Brian Acton, that read, "No Ads! No Games! No Gimmicks!" WhatsApp's other Co-founder Jan Koum used to keep the note taped to his desk. WhatsApp Co-founders quit Facebook a few years after WhatsApp's acquisition.

286.title: Always being told I was fat hurt me, my dad made me feel ugly: Britney Spears
286.article_body: Singer Britney Spears said that one of the things that hurt her the most in her childhood was always being told that she was fat and not good enough. "My dad always made me feel like I had to try...He ruined the deep seed of my existence...my confidence...my swag...He made me feel ugly...therefore I was," she added.

287.title: Today’s India is like plane flying in reverse, it’s headed for crash: Arundhati Roy
287.article_body: Author Arundhati Roy on Wednesday compared "today’s India" to a plane moving in reverse which is "headed for a crash". "The leaders of this country are flying the plane in reverse, everything is falling, and we are headed for a crash," Roy added. She was speaking at the launch of the book "Why do you fear my way so much?"

288.title: Oh my God: PM Modi to Indian journalists not allowed to cover event in Berlin
288.article_body: A video of PM Narendra Modi exclaiming 'Oh my God!' to Indian journalists in Germany has gone viral on social media. The incident took place when the journalists complained to PM Modi that they were not allowed to cover an event in Berlin. Reacting to it, PM Modi said, "Oh my God!" and added that he will inquire about it.

289.title: There hasn't been a better spell in his IPL career: Irfan on Maxwell’s 2/22 vs CSK
289.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan praised RCB all-rounder Glenn Maxwell for registering figures of 2/22 against CSK, stating that there hasn't been a better spell in the 33-year-old's IPL career. "He bowled with his brain...the turning point...came through him...Maxwell dismissed the two batters who play spin the best," Irfan added. Maxwell dismissed Robin Uthappa and Ambati Rayudu.

290.title: Couldn't have added anything to Congress: Prashant on declining offer
290.article_body: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor said that he "couldn't have added anything to Congress". "There were thorough discussions on the ways required for the betterment of the party...I am grateful that they listened to me. But I felt I won't be able to add anything to the party. Hence, I declined the offer," he added.

291.title: Father of boy who sang for PM Modi in Germany responds after Kamra posts edited video
291.article_body: After comedian Kunal Kamra posted an edited video of the boy who sang a patriotic song for PM Narendra Modi in Germany, his father tweeted, "Though he is still very young but certainly he loves his country more than you Mr Kamra or Kachra whatever you are." "Try to work on your poor jokes," he wrote.

292.title: Will always be there rooting for you: Ajay as Akshay completes 30 yrs in B'wood
292.article_body: As actor Akshay Kumar completed 30 years in the Bollywood industry, his close friend, actor Ajay Devgn, shared a note on his social media handle and wished him a successful journey ahead. He wrote, "Congratulations Akki. 30 years in cinema and several more decades to come. Hope you set new records. Will always be there rooting & cheering for you."

293.title: 1,500 mosques, 1,300 temples allowed to use loudspeakers in Maha: Police
293.article_body: Approximately 1,500 mosques and 1,300 temples in Maharashtra, excluding Mumbai have been given permission to use loudspeakers amid the ongoing issue on the use of loudspeakers in religious places, police said on Wednesday. "Preventative action taken against more than 2,300 people. Notice...given to around 7,000 persons on 3rd-4th May," Maharashtra Police added.

294.title: 5 killed, 4 injured after auto-rickshaw collides with truck in MP
294.article_body: Five people died and four others were injured after an auto-rickshaw collided head-on with a mini truck in Madhya Pradesh's Raisen district on Thursday. The accident took place around 3 am near Tedia bridge when the auto-rickshaw was heading towards Bhopal. Four occupants of the auto-rickshaw and a minor girl travelling in the truck were killed, an official said.

295.title: I regret WhatsApp's $22 bn sale to Facebook: WhatsApp's ex-CBO Arora
295.article_body: WhatsApp's former Chief Business Officer (CBO) Neeraj Arora tweeted, "I helped negotiate the $22 billion sale to Facebook (in 2014). Today, I regret it." He said, "Our stance was very clear: No mining user data, No ads (ever), No cross-platform tracking...Of course, that's not what happened." He added, "Today...WhatsApp is a shadow of the product we poured our hearts into."

296.title: Wish my life was as interesting as it sounded: Kriti on link-up rumours
296.article_body: When asked what she thinks about the link-up rumours with her co-stars, actress Kriti Sanon said, "These petty things...don't bother me at all." "It just makes you feel like 'I wish my life was as interesting as it sounded it to be'," she added. Kriti further said that she knows all of this is a part of being a celebrity.

297.title: 40-year-old Noida woman threatens to jump from balcony, police rescue her
297.article_body: Noida Police rescued and brought back to safety a 40-year-old woman, who was allegedly standing on her balcony and was threatening to jump. Officials said that the Noida Police reached the woman's house, talked to her and brought her inside the house from the balcony. Police said that the woman was going through a depressive phase due to marital dispute.

298.title: 3 held, 37 detained after stone-pelting reported in Delhi's Welcome area
298.article_body: Delhi Police arrested three people and detained 37 others after a stone-pelting incident was reported in the national capital's Welcome area on Wednesday night. According to the police, first, the quarrel took place between the children from both the groups, then it spread to the people of the two communities resulting in stone-pelting. Further investigation is underway, police said.

299.title: 22-yr-old man makes hoax calls about blowing up Unnao railway station, held
299.article_body: A 22-year-old man was arrested for making two hoax calls and threatening to blow up the Ganga Ghat railway station in Uttar Pradesh's Unnao. "We formed a team, traced the calls and arrested the youth within 24 hours," a police official said. The accused made both the calls on May 2.

300.title: Chennai man who died in police custody had 13 wounds: Post-mortem report
300.article_body: Post-mortem report of the 25-year-old man, Vignesh, who had died in police custody in Chennai last month, has revealed that he had 13 different wounds, including 12 contusions and one abrasion. Earlier, a CCTV footage showing policemen running after him and beating him had surfaced online. He had been arrested on April 18 over alleged possession of marijuana.

301.title: I feel like what the guys in 'Lagaan' movie felt: RCB's Harshal Patel on win vs CSK
301.article_body: Referring to their 13-run win against CSK, RCB bowling all-rounder Harshal Patel said, "Very satisfying. I feel like what the guys in 'Lagaan' movie felt after they won the match and it started raining." He added, "It was a drought for the team and myself as well. Really happy that we're over that now." Harshal took three wickets against CSK.

302.title: Warning issued for fresh spell of heatwave over 6 states/UTs; list released
302.article_body: The IMD has said that a fresh spell of heatwave conditions is likely to commence over northwest India from May 7 and over central India from May 8. Heatwave conditions are likely over north Madhya Maharashtra on May 5, over Rajasthan between May 7-9, over south Haryana, Delhi, southwest Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh and Vidarbha on May 8 and 9.

303.title: Woman found alive almost 6 days after China building collapse
303.article_body: A woman was pulled alive from the rubble of a building that partially collapsed on April 29 in China's Changsha, state media reported on Thursday. Officials said at least five people have died as a result of the collapse. Authorities have arrested nine people, including the owner of the building, on suspicion of ignoring building codes or committing other violations.

304.title: Rahul, Priyanka should visit Raj & witness violent incidents: BJP leader
304.article_body: BJP state in-charge Arun Singh has asked Congress leader Rahul Gandhi to return from Nepal at the soonest and visit Rajasthan following Jodhpur violence. "He (Rahul) and Priyanka Gandhi should visit the state and witness the violent incidents," Singh added. "He should instruct the state government to maintain law and order and not indulge in appeasement politics," Singh stated.

305.title: 2 open fire in Bhajanpura, Delhi Police personnel's husband injured
305.article_body: Delhi Police has said that the preliminary investigation into the Bhajanpura firing on Wednesday revealed that two people opened fire upon another duo over personal enmity. Two people, including a Delhi Police personnel's husband, were injured in the firing. The prime suspect was having personal enmity with one of the victims on the issue of a love affair, police added.

306.title: Tomato prices soar in Bengaluru amid supply shortage
306.article_body: The rates of vegetables in Bengaluru have increased due to rise in temperature and the price of tomatoes has almost reached ₹50-65/kilogram. "The production of tomatoes in neighbouring Maharashtra has dropped over last few weeks and hence, the supply has been hit," an official said. The prices of beans and cauliflowers have also increased due to a shortage in supply.

307.title: It compelled me to do things I had never done before: Ayushmann on 'Anek'
307.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana said his character 'Joshua' in the upcoming film 'Anek' "compelled" him to do things he had never done before, physically and mentally. "I gave this role my best shot to bring life to everything director Anubhav Sinha envisioned for the film," added Ayushmann. Discussing 'Anek', Anubhav termed it as his "most challenging" film so far.

308.title: If DC lose against SRH, their campaign might derail: Ajay Jadeja
308.article_body: Ex-India batter Ajay Jadeja said DC's match against SRH on Thursday is crucial for the Rishabh Pant-led side as their campaign might derail if they lose the game. "They've played one game lesser than other franchises, but have only eight points...this is a hugely significant moment for DC," he added. DC have won four of their nine games so far.

309.title: RSS, BJP planned to incite riots in Jodhpur, Karauli: Rajasthan CM
309.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Thursday said that the RSS and BJP were planning to incite riots in Karauli, Jodhpur and Ramgarh. "They (RSS and BJP) are setting agenda…We took timely action and due to that only small incidents occurred but we've arrested culprits and won't spare anyone," Gehlot added. "We will not allow violence in the state," Gehlot stated.

310.title: Shah flags off boat ambulance at BSF's floating outpost in Bengal
310.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday flagged off a boat ambulance at a floating BSF outpost, which he inaugurated, in West Bengal. Shah is on a two-day visit to the state in which he is scheduled to attend various events. He was received at the Kolkata airport by BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari and MoS Home Nisith Pramanik.

311.title: Can't afford US anti-submarine helicopters: Taiwan
311.article_body: Taiwan on Thursday signalled that it has abandoned a plan to buy advanced new anti-submarine warfare helicopters from the US, saying, "The price is too high, beyond the scope of our country's ability." Taiwan is currently undertaking a military modernisation programme to improve its capabilities to fend off any Chinese attack. China claims democratically-governed Taiwan as its own territory.

312.title: I tell Arjun I want to grow old with him, I know he's my man: Malaika
312.article_body: Speaking about her boyfriend-actor Arjun Kapoor, actress Malaika Arora said they are at a place where they think about 'what next'. "We'd love to see a future together and see where we can take it from here," she added. "I...tell him...'I want to grow old with you'. We'll figure out the rest, but I know he's my man," Malaika said.

313.title: FIR against e-commerce site for selling abortion kits without prescription
313.article_body: The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has registered a case against an e-commerce website for selling abortion kits without a prescription. A food inspector at FDA placed an order for medical termination of pregnancy (MTP) pill on Amazon without providing a doctor's prescription and received the delivery after a few days. The FDA also found discrepancy in the seller ID.

314.title: NDMC seals 14 unlicensed meat shops, seizes 500 kg of meat in Delhi
314.article_body: North Delhi Municipal Corporation (NDMC) on Wednesday sealed 14 unlicensed meat shops and seized around 500 kg of meat in Delhi. Out of this, 10 shops were sealed in the City-Sadar Paharganj zone, three in Narela zone and one in Rohini zone. "The goal was to maintain public health standards as, during summer, eatables spoil easily," an NDMC official said.

315.title: Williamson has to work on his batting, it's a massive concern: Chawla
315.article_body: Cricketer-commentator Piyush Chawla said SRH captain Kane Williamson needs to work on his batting, adding that his performances with the bat are a "massive concern". "Williamson is a player around whom the entire [SRH] batting unit revolves," stated Chawla. Williamson has scored 195 runs in IPL 2022 so far at a strike rate of 99.48.

316.title: 35 passengers escape unhurt after bus catches fire in Nagpur
316.article_body: As many as 35 passengers escaped unhurt after a bus caught fire near the Reserve Bank square in Maharashtra's Nagpur on Thursday, a fire official said. The blaze started from the engine side, following which the passengers quickly got down from the bus, the official added. The bus, run by the civic body, was going to Khaparkheda, the official stated.

317.title: Sedition law should not be struck down: Centre tells Supreme Court
317.article_body: The sedition law should not be struck down but there is a need for guidelines, Centre told the Supreme Court. Attorney General KK Venugopal argued that a law may not become invalid just because it's been misused. Meanwhile, Kapil Sibal, the lawyer representing petitioners, invoked Mahatma Gandhi saying, "Mahatma said it is a right to create disaffection against the government."

318.title: Woman dragged by car as she tries to intervene between 2 arguing drivers in Delhi
318.article_body: A woman was allegedly dragged and slapped by two men in a car in Delhi's Amar Colony. The woman reportedly tried to intervene in an argument taking place between two drivers when the incident took place. One of the accused was arrested by the police and identified as 25-year-old Udayvir Singh, a resident of Faridabad.

319.title: Not concerned about Jadeja's form: CSK head coach Stephen Fleming
319.article_body: CSK head coach Stephen Fleming has said he's not concerned about all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja's form in IPL 2022. "When you are batting at number five or six, you don't get a lot of time to get the tempo or rhythm right," explained Fleming. So far, Jadeja has scored 116 runs in 10 games. He was dismissed for 3(5) vs RCB.

320.title: Klopp's big chance to get revenge: Wenger on Liverpool-Madrid CL final
320.article_body: Discussing the Champions League final between Liverpool and Real Madrid, ex-Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger said, "This is [Liverpool manager] Jurgen Klopp's big chance to get...revenge [for] the 2018 CL final." Madrid defeated Liverpool 3-1 in the final of the 2018 edition of the Champions League. Real Madrid beat Manchester City 6-5 on aggregate in their Champions League semi-final this edition.

321.title: Heard breaks down in court, says 'When Depp slapped me for 1st time, it changed my life'
321.article_body: Actress Amber Heard broke down in the court while testifying in her ex-husband's Johnny Depp's defamation trial against her. Amber alleged Depp slapped her for the first time in 2012 after she had asked him about his tattoo. "I'd never been hit like that. He slapped me for no reason. I'll never forget it, it changed my life," Heard added.

322.title: Salman bhai played the perfect host, he was last to leave: Aayush on Eid party
322.article_body: Actor Aayush Sharma said his brother-in-law, Salman Khan, was the perfect host at the Eid party, which was hosted by the former and his wife Arpita Khan. "Salman bhai wanted to do it in a grand way and suggested...we host it at our home," he added. "He took care of...the guests...In fact, he was the last to leave," Aayush said.

323.title: Delhi to see partly cloudy skies, thunder and lightning today: IMD
323.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted partly cloudy skies with possibility of thunder and lightning in Delhi today. According to IMD, the maximum temperature is likely to settle around 38°C today. Though western disturbances recently brought relief to Northwest India, the maximum temperature is likely to rise by three to four degrees during the next three days, IMD said.

324.title: Men, boys being raped by Russian soldiers in Ukraine
324.article_body: Russian soldiers in Ukraine have been allegedly raping men and boys, United Nations and Ukrainian officials said. "It's hard for women and girls to report rape because of stigma amongst other reasons, but it's often even harder for men and boys to report," Special Representative of the Secretary-General on Sexual Violence in Conflict, Pramila Patten, said.

325.title: He will have no place even here: Lalu on Prashant Kishor's return to Bihar
325.article_body: Reacting to poll strategist Prashant Kishor's announcement that he will "start from Bihar", RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav said that he has come back to Bihar as people everywhere else have sent him back. He will have no place even here, he added. On May 2, Kishor tweeted, "Time to go to the Real Masters."

326.title: Railways to run its first 'Bharat Gaurav' train on June 21
326.article_body: Railways will run its first 'Bharat Gaurav' train on June 21, which would include a stop at Nepal's Janakpur, the Railways said. The train will take people on an 18-day tour covering prominent places associated with life of Lord Ram. The first stop of the train will be in Ayodhya. The price of tour package starts from ₹62,370 per person.

327.title: Prashant Kishor announces 3,000-km Bihar 'padyatra', says no party for now
327.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor on Thursday said that he will carry out a 3,000-kilometre 'padyatra' in Bihar beginning October 2 amid speculations that he is going to form a new political party. However, Kishor said that he is not going to form a political party as of now. "I am going to talk to around 17,000-18,000 people," he added.

328.title: Robbers tamper with ATM, escape with cash in Pune; police launch hunt
328.article_body: Two unidentified suspects allegedly tampered with the sensor of the cash dispenser at an ATM kiosk in Pune's Model Colony and fled with ₹5,000 cash that a user failed to withdraw due to malfunction. Pune City Police have launched a search for the two suspects. The incident reportedly took place on April 27 between 11:50 am and 12:20 pm.

329.title: Mumbai's Kokilaben Hospital completes 4,500 robot-assisted surgeries
329.article_body: The Kokilaben Dhirubhai Ambani Hospital has received its third da Vinci Robotic Surgical System and has completed 4,500 robot-assisted surgeries. It has also become the first hospital to have completed 2,600 robot-assisted surgeries for patients with prostate, kidney and urinary bladder cancer. The hospital had introduced the system in June 2012.

330.title: I don't have a chance: Ex-world no. 1 Murray on match against Djokovic
330.article_body: Discussing his upcoming match against world number one Novak Djokovic in the third round of the Madrid Open 2022, former world number one Andy Murray said, "In theory, I should have no chance in the match." "It's a great opportunity for me," added Murray. Murray will face Djokovic for the first time since the Qatar Open final in 2017.

331.title: Man stabbed to death in suspected honour killing case in Hyderabad
331.article_body: A man was stabbed to death by two persons in Hyderabad's Saroornagar on Wednesday in a suspected case of honour killing, police said. The man and his wife, riding a bike, were attacked with an iron rod following which the latter was injured, police added. Two brothers of the deceased man's wife have been identified as the accused.

332.title: 4 kids drown in MP dam, CM announces ₹4 lakh ex-gratia for kin
332.article_body: Four kids, including one boy and three girls, died after drowning in the Machagora dam in Madhya Pradesh's Chhindwara district. Expressing grief over the incident, Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan announced an ex-gratia of ₹4 lakh each to the families of the victims. "I pray for the peace of the innocent children's souls and strength for the family," he tweeted.

333.title: 20 IAS officers among 33 bureaucrats transferred by J&K administration
333.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir administration on Wednesday ordered the transfer of 33 bureaucrats including 20 IAS officers. Divisional commissioner of Jammu and six deputy commissioners are among those transferred with immediate effect. While senior IAS officer Ashok Parmar has been posted as Principal Secretary of Jal Shakti Department, IAS officer Avny Lavasa has been posted as Deputy Commissioner of Jammu.

334.title: Man, out in forest with female friend, killed by tiger in Maha
334.article_body: A 21-year-old man, who was out in the forest with his female friend, was killed by a tiger in Maharashtra's Gadchiroli district on Tuesday. According to a forest official, the couple, riding a two-wheeler, ventured deep into the Ussegaon forest. The tiger suddenly pounced on the victim, identified as Ajit Nakade, and dragged him away, said the official.

335.title: 2 including Nigerian national cheat people of ₹2.75 cr, held by Ahmedabad Police
335.article_body: Two persons, including a 39-year-old Nigerian national from Mumbai, were arrested by the Ahmedabad Cyber Crime Cell for allegedly cheating 13 persons to the tune of ₹2.75 crore in guise of exporting herbal extract. "Their modus operandi was to connect with people on social media and seek their interest in doing business with a fake Poland-based company," an official said.

336.title: He ripped my underwear off, shoved fingers inside me looking for cocaine: Heard on Depp
336.article_body: While testifying in Johnny Depp's defamation trial against her, actress Amber Heard claimed during a weekend getaway in May 2013, the actor sexually abused her. She added that Depp ripped her dress and underwear off and conducted a cavity search to look for cocaine. "He...shoved his fingers inside me...I just stood there staring at the stupid light," Heard said.

337.title: Novak Djokovic knows how to defend his justice: Vladimir Kamelzon
337.article_body: Russian coach Vladimir Kamelzon said world number one Novak Djokovic knows how to defend his justice, adding that Djokovic is a unique person who has his own opinion. "In my eyes, he is the number one player in the history of tennis. He has a special relationship," stated Kamelzon. "Djokovic is the first racket of the world," said Kamelzon.

338.title: Mom says rats nibbled infant's knees in J'khand, probe panel set up
338.article_body: Mother of a girl child who was born on April 29 said that her child's knees had allegedly been nibbled by rats at a hospital in Jharkhand. The infant was rushed to another hospital in critical condition but is stable now. Reports said that a committee to probe the incident has been set up after family's complaints.

339.title: Fan shares pic of Livingstone's 'crocodile' catching style, cricketer says 'My bad habit'
339.article_body: A cricket fan took to Twitter to share a picture of PBKS' Liam Livingstone's catching style, comparing it to a crocodile opening and closing its mouth. "It's the end result that matters...right? It's a bad habit of mine I've always done," the cricketer responded to the fan. "Was Jonty Rhodes okay with this catching technique of yours?" another fan commented.

340.title: Trainees forced to drink human semen with fish sauce by Navy officer in Thailand
340.article_body: A Navy officer in Thailand has been jailed after video footage that allegedly showed him forcing trainee marines to drink human semen mixed with fish sauce surfaced online. The clip was filmed at a naval training camp in Chon Buri's Sattahip district in October but surfaced last week. Senior officials apologised to the trainees and their families for the abuse.

341.title: Bangladeshi girl rescued from prostitution in Andhra Pradesh
341.article_body: A Bangladeshi girl was rescued from prostitution in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam by the city police on Wednesday. The girl reportedly entered India illegally and stayed in Kolkata for a few days with a person named Munir. He later sent the girl to Visakhapatnam, where two other accused introduced her to prostitution and confined her in a house, police said.

342.title: HC upholds Osmania University decision to deny Rahul Gandhi visit
342.article_body: The Telangana High Court has upheld Hyderabad's Osmania University's decision to deny Congress leader Rahul Gandhi a visit to meet students on May 7. The Congress party had moved the court after the university rejected an application for the visit. Youth leaders of the party had protested against the university's decision, while students affiliated with ABVP and TRS organised counter-protests.

343.title: Without Lomror, RCB wouldn't have reached 173 vs CSK: Sehwag
343.article_body: Praising RCB all-rounder Mahipal Lomror for his performance against CSK, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said RCB wouldn't have reached 173/8 without the 22-year-old's knock of 42 off 27 deliveries. "It was an important, crucial innings from Lomror. He set the platform for Dinesh Karthik to do his work," added Sehwag. RCB defeated CSK by 13 runs in the game.

344.title: I've never leaked a sex tape, the Kardashians have abused my name: Ray J
344.article_body: Discussing his sex tape featuring then-girlfriend Kim Kardashian, which leaked in 2007, singer Ray J said, "I have never leaked a sex tape in my life." "I have sat in the shadows for over 14 years allowing the Kardashians to...abuse my name, make billions of dollars over a decade and a half talking about a topic I've never...[discussed]," added Ray.

345.title: Let's hope we haven't left it too late and can peak towards the end: Maxwell
345.article_body: After defeating CSK to register their sixth win in IPL 2022, RCB all-rounder Glenn Maxwell said they're going in the right direction and can hopefully peak towards the end of the league stage. "[Hopefully, we can] find a way into the top four...do some damage in the finals," he added. Maxwell dismissed Robin Uthappa and Ambati Rayudu in the match.

346.title: Colombia extradites 'world's most dangerous drug trafficker' to US
346.article_body: Colombia has extradited Dairo Antonio Usuga, alias Otoniel, who'd been the country's most-wanted drug lord before his capture, to the US. He's wanted in America for crimes including drug trafficking, conspiracy and illegally possessing weapons. Colombian President Ivan Duque said Otoniel wasn't only the "world's most dangerous drug trafficker" but also a "murderer" and "abuser of boys and girls".

347.title: Chandigarh resident cheated of ₹4 lakh while trying to update KYC
347.article_body: A Chandigarh resident was cheated of ₹4.34 lakh minutes after he clicked a web link shared on his mobile phone to update KYC details pertaining to his savings bank account. The person who called the victim had introduced himself as a bank representative. The link was shared from a mobile number which was later found registered to a fake identity.

348.title: Been 1 year, it's as painful as 1st day: Nikki on brother's death anniversary
348.article_body: Actress Nikki Tamboli shared a video of her late brother on his first death anniversary and said that the last one year has been the longest for her. "One year has passed since you left...After a year, it is still as painful as the first day...I will always know that I'll never get to hug you again," she wrote.

349.title: NDMC sets up separate registration counters for suspected COVID patients
