349.article_body: Amid rise in COVID-19 cases in the national capital, the North Delhi Municipal Corporation (NDMC) has set up separate registration counters for suspected coronavirus patients at its health facilities. In a statement, the NDMC added that it will also "provide one month's advance medicines to patients suffering from chronic diseases". Notably, Delhi reported 1,354 fresh Covid-19 cases on Wednesday.

350.title: Tamil Nadu Governor sends anti-NEET bill for President's approval
350.article_body: After re-enactment of a bill seeking exemption for Tamil Nadu students from the National Entrance-cum-Eligibility Test (NEET), Governor RN Ravi sent the anti-NEET bill to the Centre for President's approval. "Bill will be rejected by the President," state BJP chief K Annamalai said. Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam workers had protested against the Governor for not sending the bill to the President.

351.title: BJP 'hero' in publicity, Cong failed to publicise its work: Ghulam Nabi
351.article_body: Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad said that BJP government is a "hero" in publicity and called Congress "zero". "Their (BJP) government is a hero in publicity but we were zero in publicity…completely zero...It's good, I appreciate them and I blame myself, my government and my party that we failed miserably, whatever we did we could not publicise," Azad added.

352.title: Diego Maradona's 'Hand of God' shirt sells for world-record £7.14 million at auction
352.article_body: The shirt that late Argentine legend Diego Maradona wore when he scored 'Hand of God' goal against England in 1986 World Cup sold for a world-record price of £7.14 million at a London auction. It surpasses the previous records for a match-worn jersey and a piece of sports memorabilia. Maradona had also scored 'Goal of the Century' in that match.

353.title: Biometric data for Aadhaar can't be used to identify criminals: UIDAI to Delhi HC
353.article_body: Biometric data collected for Aadhaar cannot be used to identify criminals or solve crimes, the UIDAI has told Delhi High Court. It said that sharing or use of biometric information for purposes other than the generation of the Aadhaar number is "impermissible" under the Aadhaar Act, 2016. It added that it anyway doesn't collect biometric information suitable for forensic purposes.

354.title: 2 arrested with heroin worth ₹3 crore in Nagaland's Kohima
354.article_body: Nagaland Police arrested two persons and allegedly seized 615 gram of heroin from them in Kohima on Wednesday. According to the police, the seized amount of drug is valued at ₹3 crore in the international market. Giving details about the incident, police said, "We have intercepted one suspicious vehicle and recovered 49 packets of suspected heroin."

355.title: Not stepping into someone's shoes: Kiara on comparison with Vidya in 'Bhool...'
355.article_body: Kiara Advani said she's "not stepping into someone's shoes" in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' after her performance is being compared to Vidya Balan's performance in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa'. Kiara added they've tried to retain the essence of the original film and some elements including Manjulika's name. "This isn't a psychological thriller but a horror-comedy. There's a layer of black magic," she said.

356.title: Russia resorting to missile terrorism to spread fear: Ukraine
356.article_body: Amid intense bombardment by Russian forces, Ukraine has accused them of using  "missile terrorism". Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba said that Russia is "resorting to the missile terrorism tactics in order to spread fear across Ukraine." Meanwhile, the Russian military said that it used missiles to destroy power facilities at five railway stations across Ukraine.

357.title: US intelligence helped Ukraine kill Russian generals: Report
357.article_body: The US provided Ukraine with intelligence that allowed them to target and kill many of the Russian generals who've died in the ongoing war, The New York Times reported citing senior American officials. The report said Ukraine combined location and other details from US with their own intelligence to conduct artillery strikes and other attacks that have killed Russian officers.

358.title: Taliban force Shias to break Eid fast early: Report
358.article_body: The Taliban reportedly forced Shia Muslims in Afghanistan to break their fasts before the Shia announcement of Eid. They also barred Shia mosques from holding Eid prayers, said reports. "Taliban forces prohibited dozens of Shia mosques from holding Eid prayers…Shia activists reported this violation of religious rights in Herat and Kabul," local journalist Massoud Hossaini said on Twitter.

359.title: Internet services suspended in Bhilwara for 24 hours after attack on 2 people
359.article_body: Internet services were suspended in the Bhilwara city in Rajasthan for 24 hours, District Collector Ashish Modi said on Thursday. This comes after two people were attacked by unknown persons when they were having food in the Sanganer area on Wednesday night. "Their bike was also set ablaze. We are investigating the matter," Modi added.

360.title: IT firm offers free matchmaking service to staff, hike on getting married in TN
360.article_body: An IT company headquartered in Madurai offers its employees free matchmaking service and a hike when they get married. "Employees treat me like a brother and several of them are from villages, with either aged parents or lacking a proper outlook of the world and unable to find the right match," CEO of Sri Mookambika Infosolutions MP Selvaganesh said.

361.title: Russia practises simulated nuclear-capable missile strikes
361.article_body: Russia on Wednesday said its forces practised simulated nuclear-capable missile strikes in the western enclave of Kaliningrad, amid the war in Ukraine. The forces practised single and multiple strikes at targets imitating launchers of missile systems, airfields, protected infrastructure, military equipment and command posts of a mock enemy, the Russian Defence Ministry added.

362.title: Real Madrid pull off comeback to defeat Man City, reach Champions League final
362.article_body: Real Madrid entered the Champions League final after defeating Manchester City 6-5 on aggregate in the semi-final. In the semi-final's second leg on Wednesday night, Madrid trailed 1-0 and 5-3 on aggregate heading into the 90th minute when Rodrygo scored twice to send the game to extra time. Karim Benzema then scored an extra-time penalty to win the tie.

363.title: India has seen communal tensions since 7th century: BJP leader CT Ravi
363.article_body: BJP leader CT Ravi on Wednesday said communal tension is not new in India. "It started from the first attack on India in the 7th century, not from today," Ravi said. "Some people try to create communal tension. There are some intolerant faiths," he added. His remarks came following recent communal clashes reported from across the country.

364.title: There is a swimming pool in PM Modi's plane: Adhir Chowdhury
364.article_body: Reacting to BJP's criticism on Rahul Gandhi's Nepal tour, Congress leader Adhir Chowdhury said that there is a swimming pool in PM Narendra Modi's new plane, reported Times Now citing media reports. Chowdhury also claimed that PM Modi bought two planes worth ₹13,000 crore and used to take bath in the pool while travelling to foreign countries, the report said.

365.title: 150 MNS workers arrested in Nashik for allegedly creating communal tension
365.article_body: As many as 150 workers from the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) were arrested in Nashik for allegedly creating communal tension in the district, local police officials informed. The arrests have been made as part of preventive actions taken to maintain law and order in the state, following MNS chief Raj Thackeray's appeal to play Hanuman Chalisa on loudspeakers outside mosques.

366.title: India has sufficient stock of wheat to sustain for a year: Centre
366.article_body: India currently has more than the required quantity of wheat in stocks to sustain for a year, Sudhanshu Pandey, Secretary, Department of Food and Public Distribution, said. Due to an increase in the market prices and higher demand by the private players, both for domestic and export purposes, farmers are getting a good price for the wheat, Sudhanshu added.

367.title: Couldn't sleep during Love Hostel, broke down on set; spoke to therapist: Sanya
367.article_body: Actress Sanya Malhotra said that her character from 'Love Hostel' was emotionally overwhelming for her. "During the shoot, I remember not being able to sleep at night and feeling uneasy all day. In fact, I remember breaking down on the set of the film one day. That's when I spoke to my therapist," she added.

368.title: 'Jayeshbhai' and I are both accidental heroes: Ranveer on 'Jayeshbhai...'
368.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said he and his character 'Jayeshbhai' in his upcoming film 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' are both "accidental heroes". "There are several parallels between my life and 'Jayeshbhai's' life. In playing 'Jayeshbhai', I was able to tap into my own...experiences," added Ranveer. "With the odds stacked against yourself, you turn to the power that love gives you," stated Ranveer.

369.title: Mumbai man held for 18th time over sexual abuse, was addicted to adult content
369.article_body: A 30-year-old Mumbai-based man was arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a minor girl who was playing in her housing society. The police found that the accused had already been arrested 17 times before in cases of molestation and kidnapping. The accused got addicted to watching adult content when he was younger, after which he started molesting women, the police said.

370.title: A journey from ₹1000 to ₹30 lacs, meet Avinash Koneru: Adda52
370.article_body: Adda52 announced Avinash Koneru as the winner of its Big Millions Tournament. The brand revealed that the Bangalore-based IT professional qualified through a ₹1,100 buy-in satellite tournament and received a sum of ₹31,63,652 from the prize pool of ₹2 crore, adding that he is the true epitome of what one can achieve with continuous efforts and dedication.

371.title: Journalist attacked with iron rod, robbed of cash in Punjab's Zirakpur
371.article_body: A media person, Alok Verma, who works in a vernacular daily published from Panchkula, was attacked with an iron rod by unknown bikers on Tuesday in Punjab's Zirakpur. The attackers, who followed him while he was going home, reportedly hit him on the head with the rod and took away his cash and cell phone. Verma has been hospitalised.

372.title: BSF discovers suspected tunnel near Indo-Pak border in J&K
372.article_body: The BSF on Wednesday detected a suspected tunnel near India-Pakistan border in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba district. A small opening was found near the fencing in the Samba area during patrolling by BSF personnel at around 5:30 pm, according to reports quoting sources. The officials said almost a fortnight ago, two Jaish-e-Mohammed suicide bombers, who infiltrated from Pakistan, were killed.

373.title: There have been many reasons: Mrunal on Jersey's box office failure
373.article_body: Speaking about Jersey's poor performance at the box office, actress Mrunal Thakur said that it's disappointing. "There have been many external reasons. But yes, one does tend to feel low. Anyway, we will work harder next time," she added. Mrunal said she has "no idea" what audiences want, especially after the success of South Indian films like 'RRR' and 'Pushpa'.

374.title: Railway collects ₹2.4 crore as fines for ticketless travel in Pune
374.article_body: Pune Railway Division collected ₹2.47 crore in the month of April as fines from 36,579 ticketless travellers, its highest monthly collection. Another 101 passengers were fined ₹46,629 for travelling in an improper way, including travelling while being drunk. "Passengers unable to pay fine will be arrested by the railway police," Manoj Jhawar, spokesperson for Pune Railway Division, said.

375.title: India reports 3,275 new COVID-19 cases, 55 deaths in 24 hours
375.article_body: India has reported 3,275 COVID-19 cases, 3,010 recoveries and 55 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,205 COVID-19 cases and 31 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 19,719, while the death toll has risen to 5,23,975.

376.title: Virat Kohli's aggressive celebration after MS Dhoni's dismissal goes viral, fans react
376.article_body: A video of RCB batter Virat Kohli's aggressive celebration after CSK captain MS Dhoni's dismissal in their IPL 2022 match went viral. Reacting to the celebration, a fan tweeted, "Can't match the aggression he shows while wearing RCB jersey." "Dhoni fans taking their frustration out on Kohli's routine celebration is peak Twitter," wrote another.

377.title: Fake Whatsapp account created in Lok Sabha Speaker's name, 3 arrested
377.article_body: A fake WhatsApp account was created in Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla's name following which three persons were arrested by the Odisha Police. "Some miscreants have created a fake account in my name with profile photo and sending messages to MPs...Matter has been reported to authorities...Please ignore calls/messages from these and other numbers and inform my office," the Speaker tweeted.

378.title: I've been trying to improve my sequencing: Harshal on 3/35 vs CSK
378.article_body: RCB pacer Harshal Patel, who was named Man of the Match for his performance against CSK, has said he has been trying to improve his sequencing in the ongoing IPL season. "When people are waiting for the slower balls, my hard length balls and my yorkers are released," he added. Harshal dismissed Moeen Ali, Ravindra Jadeja and Dwaine Pretorius.

379.title: BMC to make EV charging points mandatory in new buildings across Mumbai
379.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is planning to make electric vehicle (EV) charging points compulsory in new buildings that would come up in Mumbai. "To encourage developers to install charging stations...offering incentives is also being discussed," a BMC official said. Moreover, the BMC is also planning to set up charging stations at 28 locations in municipal properties, he added.

380.title: He could make Twitter 'worse', but we should not underestimate him: Gates on Musk
380.article_body: At an event hosted by The Wall Street Journal, Bill Gates said Elon Musk actually could make Twitter "worse". "That's not his track record. I mean his track record with Tesla and SpaceX is pretty mind blowing...I kind of doubt that will happen this time, but we should have an open mind and never underestimate Elon," Gates added.

381.title: What let us down against RCB was batsmanship: MS Dhoni
381.article_body: CSK captain MS Dhoni said their batsmanship let them down against RCB as they lost by 13 runs on Wednesday. "When you're chasing...you have to...see what really the situation is demanding rather than playing your shots. [Our] shot selection could have been better towards the end," he added. RCB posted 173/8 and then restricted CSK to 160/8 to win.

382.title: I am not considered for any role by most casting directors: Inaamulhaq
382.article_body: Actor Inaamulhaq who featured in Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Jolly LLB 2' which released in 2017, said he is not considered for "any role" by most casting directors. "I did 10 films in the last 10 years," added Inaamulhaq. "For [my film] 'Nakkash', I got a few awards but nothing major as there's a different rule for actors like us," stated Inaamulhaq.

383.title: Dalit groom forced by villagers to get down from horse in U’khand
383.article_body: A Dalit groom was allegedly forced by some villagers to dismount a horse at his wedding in Uttarakhand’s Almora. The groom’s father filed a complaint with the SDM stating that villagers threatened to kill his son if he did not get down from the horse on Monday. The district administration has ordered a probe to verify the complaint, officials said.

384.title: Viral video shows man selling drugs on Punjab railway track, 7 held
384.article_body: Police have arrested seven people after a video of drug addicts crowding around a man openly selling drugs on a rail track in Faridkot went viral. "Taking immediate action, the accused has been arrested under relevant sections. Faridkot Police is fully committed in its fight against drugs," Faridkot SSP said. Navjot Singh Sidhu had shared the video on Twitter.

385.title: School bus catches fire after falling in burning field in Punjab, 2 injured
385.article_body: Two students were injured after a school bus caught fire after overturning and falling into a burning wheat field in Punjab's Gurdaspur on Wednesday. The incident took place at around 1:30 pm when children were being taken back home from school. FIR stated that smoke from field created zero visibility, during which, driver lost control and bus went off road.

386.title: Patiala law university declared containment zone as 60 students test COVID +ve
386.article_body: Rajiv Gandhi National University of Law (RGNUL) in Punjab's Patiala has been declared a containment zone after 60 students tested positive for COVID-19 in the last two days. "Those positive have mild symptoms and are isolated in separate blocks," Patiala DC Sakshi Sawhney said. The district administration has asked the university to get the hostels vacated by May 10.

387.title: There was zero publicity for Special OPS, hoardings were pulled down: Neeraj
387.article_body: Recalling how difficult it was to promote 'Special OPS' due to the outbreak of COVID-19, filmmaker Neeraj Pandey said the show solely survived on word of mouth. "There was zero marketing and publicity for 'Special OPS'," he added. "All our press meets were cancelled. The MCD had taken off all the hoardings to put up COVID-19 awareness posters," Neeraj said.

388.title: 34-yr-old man found dead in Chandigarh; drug overdose suspected
388.article_body: A 34-year-old daily wage labourer, who worked as a plumber, was found dead near Burail in Chandigarh under mysterious circumstances on Wednesday. Police are suspecting drug overdose behind the death, as a used syringe was found near the body. According to his family, the deceased was a drug addict. His viscera samples have been sent for forensic examination, police said.

389.title: BMC headquarters lit in purple and blue to raise awareness for Huntington's disease
389.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) illuminated its headquarters in purple and blue lights on Wednesday to raise awareness about Huntington's disease. The disease is an incurable genetic ailment that affects the brain and is caused due to  production of a disease-causing huntingtin protein. "We express solidarity with patients and families that are affected by it," the BMC said.

390.title: Loudspeakers should be banned: Minorities Commission chief
390.article_body: National Commission for Minorities chief Iqbal Singh Lalpura said that loudspeakers should be banned at religious and other public places.  "Azaan must be there. But there is also an issue of noise pollution…Loudspeakers should be banned whether they are at religious places or markets, restaurants or anywhere else," he said. The Commission is there to protect minorities, he added.

391.title: GMR Group to run Hyderabad airport for 30 more years till 2068
391.article_body: GMR Hyderabad International Airport Limited, a step-down subsidiary of GMR Infrastructure Limited, will run Rajiv Gandhi International Airport for another 30 years till 2068. This comes after the Ministry of Civil Aviation extended the terms of the Concession Agreement from March 23, 2038 up to March 22, 2068. The extension is in terms of the agreement dated December 20, 2004.

392.title: Nepali singer tweets pic with Rahul Gandhi, says 'such humble, simple person'
392.article_body: Nepali singer Saraswoti Khatri has tweeted a photo with Rahul Gandhi. They were attending former CNN correspondent Sumnima Udas' wedding. Khatri wrote, "Music has the power to bring all people together. I had an honor to sing few songs for honorable member of Indian Parliament Mr Rahul Gandhi ji yesterday evening. I found him such humble & simple person."

393.title: Were always short of money while looking for house, struggled for yrs: Supriya
393.article_body: Actress Supriya Pathak said when she and husband Pankaj Kapur were looking to buy a house, they were always a little short of money. "My father-in-law...[said] we must not go for a rented house...It's better to pay instalments for a home loan...When we took loan, whatever money could have gone into rent, we paid that much in instalments," she added.

394.title: 9, including 2 minors, held for kidnapping & killing man in Bengaluru
394.article_body: Police have arrested nine people, including two minors, for allegedly kidnapping and killing a 33-year-old man in Bengaluru. Police suspect that one of the prime accused was in a relationship with the deceased's wife, which reportedly led to the murder. The victim, who was suffering from asthma, was reportedly locked inside a luggage carrier and died due to breathlessness.

395.title: Woman proposes to boyfriend in stands during RCB-CSK match, pics go viral
395.article_body: A woman proposed to her boyfriend in the stands during the RCB-CSK match at the MCA Stadium in Pune on Wednesday. Reacting to it, former India opener Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "Smart girl proposing [to] an RCB fan. If he can stay loyal to RCB, he can definitely stay loyal to his partner...Well done and a good day to propose."

396.title: Mumbai's Dharavi reports 1st COVID-19 case since March 17
396.article_body: Mumbai's Dharavi reported one new case of COVID-19 on Wednesday, its first infection since March 17, a Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) official said. With this, Dharavi's overall count of COVID-19 cases reached 8,653, while death toll stood at 419, the official added. This comes as Mumbai reported 117 new coronavirus cases on Wednesday, its highest single-day tally since February 25.

397.title: Fire continues for 9th day at Delhi's Bhalswa landfill
397.article_body: Firefighters on Wednesday continued to douse the fire at Delhi's Bhalswa landfill, nine days after a massive fire broke out at the site last Tuesday. This is one of the longest operations as most fires, including ones at landfills, are doused in two-five days, Delhi Fire Services said. "The land is simply unapproachable...mounds are tall and unstable," an official said.

398.title: India calls for 'immediate end to hostilities' in Ukraine in joint statement with France
398.article_body: In a joint statement, India and France have called for "immediate end to hostilities" in Ukraine. "Both countries unequivocally condemned the fact that civilians have been killed in Ukraine, and called for an immediate cessation of hostilities in order for the two sides to come together...to put an immediate end to the suffering of the people," the statement read.

399.title: Mumbai doctor loses ₹1 lakh while buying discounted clothes online
399.article_body: A Mumbai doctor was cheated of ₹99,994 while purchasing discounted clothes online. Upon not receiving his order, he contacted the site's customer care but got no response. He later got a call from a person who identified himself as the company's executive and asked him to share details. The complainant later noticed four transactions worth ₹9,999 and two worth ₹20,000.

400.title: 2 dead, 1 injured after car hits electric pole on Palm Beach Road
400.article_body: While one person was grievously injured, two others died after their car hit the safety barrier and an electric pole on Navi Mumbai's Palm Beach Road on May 4. The survivor, Nitin Mathew, has been admitted to a hospital and his condition is serious. Since Mathew isn't in a condition to talk, we couldn't get much details, police said.

401.title: Father booked for negligence after son dies in bike accident near Panvel
401.article_body: A 36-year-old father has reportedly been booked for negligence after his five-year-old son died in a bike accident near Panvel. The man was riding his bike and his son was sitting on the bike's petrol tank when it collided head-on with a wall on a road's side. After the collision, the bike fell outside a bridge, causing injuries to them.

402.title: US Federal Reserve raises interest rates by 50 bps in the biggest hike in 22 years
402.article_body: The US Federal Reserve System on Wednesday raised its benchmark overnight interest rate by 50 bps, citing elevated inflation. It's the second hike in two months by the US Fed and the largest increase since 2000, which brings the key rate to a range of 0.75% to 1%. US inflation reached 6.6% last month, the highest point in four decades.

403.title: RCB defeat CSK to end their 3-match losing streak, jump to 4th on points table
403.article_body: RCB defeated CSK by 13 runs in their IPL 2022 match at the MCA Stadium in Pune on Wednesday to end their three-match losing streak. With the win, RCB jumped to the fourth position on the points table. Mahipal Lomror top-scored for RCB with 42(27), while RCB bowling all-rounder Harshal Patel took three wickets in the match.
